WHYME.TITLE: Why me
WHYME.TEXT: I’m a focused career-changer with a clear passion for frontend development. My portfolio doesn't just show projects – it reflects my learning journey. I build with structure, clarity and passion. I understand design, think in components and love solving problems. If I don’t know something yet, I’ll learn it – quickly, thoroughly, and with excitement.

SKILLS.TITLE: My Skills
SKILLS.LEARNING_TEXT: I enjoy expanding my skills and exploring new technologies like React and Vue.js.

POINTS.TITLE: About the project
POINTS.TEXT: This is a fun jump & run game made with vanilla JavaScript.

POINTS.TITLE: How I have organised my work process
POINTS.TEXT: Game logic was modularized into classes and cleanly separated.

POINTS.TITLE: My group work experience
POINTS.TEXT: Solo project with mentoring, focused on OOP and animations.

POINTS.TITLE: About the project
POINTS.TEXT: Join is a task management tool inspired by Trello. It enables collaborative task organization.

POINTS.TITLE: How I have organised my work process
POINTS.TEXT: I focused on clean code and reusable components using vanilla JavaScript.

POINTS.TITLE: My group work experience
POINTS.TEXT: I worked with a small team, coordinating tasks via Git and applying agile workflows.

POINTS.TITLE: About the project
POINTS.TEXT: Da Bubble is a Slack-inspired team communication app developed with Angular and Firebase.

POINTS.TITLE: How I have organised my work process
POINTS.TEXT: I structured the app with Angular modules, routing, services, and reusable UI components.

POINTS.TITLE: My group work experience
POINTS.TEXT: We worked collaboratively using GitHub Projects and daily check-ins.
